nodes.bodyText:
Lets rename this, we have the word Alert thrown all over our code and this is technically an AlertDialog
I was thinking something along the lines of:
showInfoAlertDialog or
showAlertDialogMessage

Add a space here messageTitle!= null
messageTitle != null

Add a space to this promptLocation,false,
promptLocation, false,

nodes.bodyText: You use these Strings in two places just move them up top outside of the first if statement

Instead of getting these string from the code get the location points I believe it should be put where the alert will be displayed. Since the string is more of a presentation layer.
This will also clean up a lot of unnecessary passing around of these values

Out of scope of this PR since it was here before this one, but I don't what onAnswered covers that isn't already by complete instead?
Maybe the differences aren't clear to me based on the name alone.
It isn't clear here by the code but it can only fall under this if block if permission were missing from the AndroidManifest.xml
Careful, we don't want to display a message if the only issue was the user denied location permission.
Granted isn't correct. Permission isn't present what we want. We don't want to show any message if the permission was simply declined.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+<resources>
+
+    <string name="location_not_available_title">Location Not Available</string>
+    <string name="location_not_available_message">Looks like this app doesn\'t have location permissions granted</string>

commit.message:
Add location permissions not available alert dialog

   * Inform the user when using preview mode that location permissions are not configured

Add Settings option to denied location prompt

   * Whenever the user clicks on never ask again option and denies the permission,
     we will show the reason why we need it and the option to open settings and change the location permission
   * Don't show setting dialog after first never ask again option click

beforeCommit.message:
Add Settings option to denied location prompt

   * Whenever the user clicks on never ask again option and denies the permission,
     we will show the reason why we need it and the option to open settings and change the location permission
   * Don't show setting dialog after first never ask again option click

afterCommit.message:
Add Settings option to denied location prompt

   * Whenever the user clicks on never ask again option and denies the permission,
     we will show the reason why we need it and the option to open settings and change the location permission
   * Don't show setting dialog after first never ask again option click
